greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Filter sequence for all such sequences b, for which b(A006254(k)) = constant for all k >= 3.
comment: Restricted growth sequence transform of A305900(A064216(n)).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..100000
formula: For n <= 3, a(n) = n, and for n >= 4, a(n) = 4 if 2n-1 is a prime (for all n in A006254[3..] = 4, 6, 7, 9, 10, 12, 15, ...), and for all other n (numbers n such that 2n-1 is composite), a(n) = running count from 5 onward.
program: partialsums(f,up_to) = { my(v = vector(up_to), s=0); for(i=1,up_to,s += f(i); v[i] = s); (v); }
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jun 14 2018
